newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan March commodity futures volume up 9.0% yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Japan March commodity futures volume up 9.0% yr/yr.

text.p: Futures trading volume on Japan's 10 commodity exchanges totalled 6,409,746 lots in March, up 9.0 percent from the same month a year ago but down 18.4 percent from February, the Japan Federation of Commodity Exchanges said on Tuesday.
Silver and rubber futures posted among the largest declines, while trading volume in soybean and palladium futures increased sharply from the same month a year earlier, the figures showed.
"Static prices in silver and rubber futures thinned volume. Private investors have been shifting money to more volatile futures such as soybeans," a federation official said.
The active Chicago soybean market fuelled speculative interest in soybean futures, while the ongoing suspension of Russian palladium exports to Japan boosted volume in that market, the official said.
Trading volumes for major commodity futures in March, with percentage changes from February and a year earlier, were as follows:
